title: The Cost Side Suppressed the Upward Space of Aluminum Prices, and Aluminum Prices May Stabilize First and Then Strengthen in October
summary: Aluminum prices initially strengthened and then weakened in September, with the average price of aluminum ingots in East China rising slightly. Prices fell primarily due to weakening costs but are expected to stabilize and then strengthen in October as destocking accelerates and costs rise.

title: Aluminum Rises Toward 3-Year High
summary: Aluminum futures rose past $2,750 per tonne in October, reaching the highest level in over three years amid tight supply and bullish long-term demand forecasts. Chinese authorities cut their annual output growth target for base metals, including aluminum, to 1.5% for 2025 and 2026, supporting the price increase.

title: A week of highs for the upstream aluminium industry - prices, policies and projects take the centre stage
summary: The LME aluminium benchmark price hit a record high for the year at USD 2,786.50 per tonne on October 9, driven by supply concerns due to production caps in China and strong demand from green industries. Strategic investments and trade discussions have also influenced market dynamics.

title: LME aluminium hits USD 2,799.5/t — steady gains or early signs of surge?
summary: LME aluminium cash offer climbed to USD 2,799.5 per tonne with 3-month prices firming, reflecting subtle market optimism amid shifting global conditions. The steady gains indicate positive sentiment in the aluminum market.

title: Aluminium price forecast: Could prices rise in 2025?
summary: Analysts forecast aluminum prices to average around $2,625 in 2025, supported by supply constraints and geopolitical factors such as tariffs and EU sanctions. The market remains nervous about potential tariff impacts, but long-term demand growth, especially from China and green industries, is expected to support prices.

title: Aluminum Rises Toward 3-Year High
summary: Aluminum futures rose toward $2,730 per tonne in October, reaching the highest level in three years amid expectations of lower supply. Chinese authorities cut their annual output growth target for base metals to 1.5% annually for 2025 and 2026, down from 5%, aligning with an aluminum output cap of 45 million tons. Alcoa announced the closure of its Kwinana alumina refinery in Australia due to deteriorating bauxite grades, while demand is supported by corporate investments in new data centers.

title: A weak of highs for the upstream aluminium industry - prices, policies and projects take the centre stage
summary: The upstream aluminum industry saw record-high prices on the London Metal Exchange, with prices reaching USD 2,786.50 per tonne. Supply concerns are driven by production caps in China and strong demand from green industries like electric vehicles. Strategic investments in bauxite projects and potential restarts of major US smelters also influenced the market dynamics.

title: LME aluminium hits USD 2,799.5/t — steady gains or early signs of surge
summary: On October 10, the London Metal Exchange aluminum price rose to USD 2,799.5 per tonne, reflecting subtle market optimism amid shifting global conditions. The 3-month bid and offer prices also increased, while inventory levels showed slight changes. The alumina price remained steady at USD 323 per tonne.

title: Al Arabia Co. for Aluminum targets over 10,000 tonnes in annual exports
summary: Al Arabia Co. for Aluminum aims to exceed 10,000 tonnes in annual exports, supported by a 75% increase in exports in the last quarter to markets including Morocco, Tunisia, Libya, Lebanon, and Canada. The company is enhancing operational efficiency through new recycling plants and facility relocations, positioning itself as a key player in regional aluminum manufacturing.

title: Weekly Recap: Aluminium's low-carbon revolution in action
summary: RUSAL has introduced an innovative electrochemical technology that converts off-grade aluminium scrap into high-purity metal, supporting the industry's shift towards low-carbon production. Taural India and Egypt Aluminium are implementing sustainability initiatives such as low-carbon casting techniques and solar energy projects to reduce emissions by up to 80% and 30%, respectively, enhancing competitiveness and environmental performance.

title: Critical Threats Facing the Global Aluminium Industry
summary: Emerging technologies like inert anode technology promise to reduce smelting carbon emissions by 60-85% by replacing carbon anodes with inert materials. Renewable energy integration and advanced recycling technologies using AI and spectroscopy are also key innovations, enabling emission reductions of 50-70% and achieving recycled aluminium purity close to primary production, thus supporting circular economy approaches.

title: LIXIL Standardizes Low-Carbon PremiAL Across Its Product Line
summary: LIXIL Corporation will incorporate PremiAL, its recycled low-carbon aluminum that reduces CO₂ emissions by approximately 50%, into all aluminum extrusion products starting October 2025 at no extra cost. This initiative leverages nearly 30 years of aluminum recycling expertise to significantly reduce embodied carbon in building materials, contributing to decarbonization in the construction industry.

title: Can circular aluminium provide a blueprint for a post-plastic world?
summary: Circular aluminium offers infinite recyclability without loss of properties, requiring only 5% of the energy compared to virgin production, making it highly eco-friendly. Despite challenges in fully replacing plastics, aluminium's extensive recycling infrastructure and sustainability benefits position it as a key material for a sustainable future and a reduction in plastic reliance.

title: Century Aluminum's sustainability blueprint for a carbon-free tomorrow
summary: Century Aluminum is advancing sustainability through low-carbon aluminium production, securing ISO certifications for environmental and safety management, and exploring global sustainability reporting frameworks. The company focuses on reducing its carbon footprint and improving operational efficiency to support a sustainable future for the aluminium industry.

title: Steel prices fall slightly but expected to rise by year-end
summary: Steel prices fell to 3,086 CNY/T on October 10, 2025, down 0.29% from the previous day. Despite this short-term dip, steel prices have risen 2.12% over the past month but remain 8.70% lower than a year ago. Analysts expect steel to trade at 3,047.39 Yuan/MT by the end of this quarter and forecast a price of 2,917.81 Yuan/MT in 12 months.

title: HRC Steel prices show modest gains with positive outlook
summary: Hot Rolled Coil (HRC) Steel prices rose to 814 USD/T on October 10, 2025, up 0.12% from the previous day. Over the past month, prices increased by 0.49% and are up 15.46% compared to the same time last year. Forecasts predict HRC Steel to reach 831.44 USD/T by the end of this quarter and 894.34 USD/T in 12 months.

title: Domestic plate steel prices could increase despite moderate demand
summary: Market sources suggest that domestic plate steel prices in the US may rise due to steady demand, lower imports, mill maintenance outages, and less impact from tariff disruptions. The US hot-rolled coil market is currently stable with prices around $795 per short ton, showing little week-on-week change.

title: US steel prices soften but remain elevated compared to global markets
summary: US domestic steel prices have softened recently from approximately $900/ton to around $800/ton but remain higher than prices in China and Europe. This reflects ongoing market dynamics including supply-demand factors and regional pricing differences.

title: JSW Steel delivers solid returns amid steady market conditions
summary: JSW Steel has delivered a 12.59% return over the last three months, reflecting strong quarterly performance and positive investor sentiment despite recent market fluctuations.

title: Tata Steel shows solid 3-month returns in a stable market
summary: Tata Steel has achieved an 8.77% return over the last three months, indicating steady performance in the steel sector amid current market trends.

title: EU Announces Higher Tariffs on Steel Imports, Raising Concerns for Scunthorpe and Humber Region Industries
summary: The European Union has announced increased import tariffs on steel products to protect domestic producers, impacting UK industries in the Scunthorpe and Humber region. The tariffs target flat and long steel, raising costs for British Steel and risking job losses in key manufacturing hubs.

title: Stegra in new financing round
summary: Stegra is in a new financing round to fund the construction of the world's first large-scale green-steel plant in Boden, Sweden. The funding will cover additional infrastructure scope, higher project costs, and provide a financial buffer, supporting Stegra's competitive position in the green steel market.

title: World Steel Association August 2025 Production Report
summary: World crude steel production for 70 countries was 145.3 million tonnes in August 2025, a 0.3% increase compared to August 2024. The steel industry continues to focus on sustainability, environmental performance, and supporting the Paris Agreement goals.

title: Hanwha Ocean, POSCO develop special steel for next-gen naval vessels
summary: Hanwha Ocean and POSCO have developed a special steel designed for next-generation naval vessels, highlighting advancements in steel technology for defense applications.

title: ACME Group to invest Rs 5,000-cr in green DRI facility for low-carbon steel production
summary: ACME Group plans to invest Rs 5,000 crore in a greenfield direct reduced iron (DRI) facility aimed at producing low-carbon steel products, supporting sustainable steel production initiatives.

title: Accelerating Innovation Through Collaboration: Sustainable Future For Australia's Resources Sector
summary: The article highlights how collaboration between research, government, and industry in Australia is accelerating the development of green steel technologies. The initiative focuses on de-risking new technologies, promoting faster adoption of green processing, and building a skilled workforce to support a sustainable, competitive green metals sector.

title: Accelerating innovation through collaboration: a sustainable future ...
summary: CSIRO discusses how interdisciplinary collaboration is advancing decarbonisation technologies for mineral processing and green steel production. Their work includes applying carbon capture to blast furnace gases and trialling hydrogen plasma smelting, alongside integrating AI and robotics to improve mining safety and efficiency.

title: Carbon Neutral Vision 2050 | Environmental activities - Nippon Steel
summary: Nippon Steel aims to reduce CO2 emissions by 30% by 2030 and achieve carbon neutrality by 2050 through breakthrough technologies such as blast furnace hydrogen reduction and hydrogen-based reduced iron production. The company plans significant R&D and capital investment to realize carbon-neutral steelmaking processes.

title: GPH Ispat pioneers green steel in Bangladesh with most advanced technology
summary: GPH Ispat in Bangladesh is leading the adoption of green steel technology, positioning itself at the forefront of sustainable steel production in the country. The company is implementing advanced technologies to reduce environmental impact and promote sustainable industrial growth.

title: thyssenkrupp Steel presents CO2-reduced bluemint® Steel at EXPO 2025 Osaka
summary: At EXPO 2025 in Osaka, thyssenkrupp Steel is showcasing its CO2-reduced bluemint® Steel, emphasizing steel's role in a sustainable circular economy. The company focuses on decarbonizing blast furnace processes to contribute to climate protection and sustainable steel production.

title: Intensifying US-China trade conflict hit LME copper last Friday
summary: LME copper prices dropped sharply last Friday, closing down 3.73% amid escalating US-China trade tensions. Chile's Codelco reported a 25% drop in copper production in August due to a mine accident, further impacting supply and increasing market volatility.

title: Copper Rebounds as US-China Tensions Ease
summary: Copper prices rebounded nearly 4% to above $5 per pound after US President Trump signaled willingness to negotiate trade relations with China. Despite easing tensions, supply disruptions in Chile and Indonesia continue to constrain output, with Chile's Codelco recording its lowest monthly production in over two decades.

title: China's Iron Ore, Copper and Coal Imports Rise to Annual High
summary: China's copper imports surged 13% in September as buyers shifted to processed metal amid mine disruptions, including at Indonesia's Grasberg mine. This increase in imports coincides with higher industrial demand during autumn and reflects China's strategic stockpiling amid ongoing trade tensions.

title: After a rally to $11,000/t, copper prices fall on the back of profit-taking
summary: Copper prices at the London Metal Exchange fell 0.9% to $10,765 per metric ton following a recent rally to $11,000 per ton, driven by profit-taking. Market activity remains influenced by supply negotiations and trade dynamics, although specific details on copper market trends were limited.

title: Intensifying US-China trade conflict hit LME copper last Friday [SMM Copper Morning Meeting Minutes]
summary: Codelco's copper production in August fell sharply by 25% to 93,400 mt due to a collapse accident at the El Teniente mine in late July, causing six deaths and severely impacting operations. The company is evaluating production resumption plans, but short-term supply disruptions are expected, contributing to increased copper price volatility amid US-China trade tensions.

title: Copper Rebounds as US-China Tensions Ease
summary: Copper prices jumped nearly 4% after US President Donald Trump indicated a willingness to negotiate trade relations with China, easing fears of an escalating trade war. Despite the price rebound, supply pressures remain due to mine disruptions in Chile and Indonesia, including Codelco's lowest monthly production in over two decades in August.

title: China's Iron Ore, Copper and Coal Imports Rise to Annual High
summary: China's copper concentrate imports dropped 6.3% due to mine disruptions like the Grasberg accident in Indonesia, but imports of unwrought copper and products surged 13% as buyers shifted to processed metal. This reflects ongoing supply challenges amid strong industrial demand and trade tensions.

title: Codelco lifts El Teniente loss estimate, copper output target intact
summary: Codelco reported copper output of 938,000 tons for the first nine months of 2025, maintaining its full-year guidance of 1.34 million tons despite the El Teniente mine accident. The company has revised its loss estimate from the accident but expects to keep its overall production target intact.

title: I-Pulse Welcomes Codelco as Strategic Investor
summary: Codelco joined I-Pulse as a strategic investor to support innovative mining technology that can reduce energy consumption in copper extraction by up to 80%. This partnership aims to improve copper production efficiency and meet growing demand driven by energy transition and technology infrastructure needs.

title: Copper Mining Process 2025: Advanced Ore To Copper Methods
summary: In 2025, copper mining has been transformed by AI-driven automation and smart analytics, cutting ore processing time by up to 30%. The industry is focusing on sustainability through increased recycling (up to 35% of global copper demand) and urban mining, integrating virgin ore extraction with recycled streams to reduce environmental impact and support the green economy.

title: Anaconda Copper Mine 2025: Innovations & Sustainability
summary: The Anaconda Copper Mine exemplifies sustainable mining innovation by employing AI, digital monitoring, eco-rehabilitation, and rapid automation. It serves as a model for balancing resource extraction with environmental stewardship and community resilience, supported by blockchain and carbon monitoring technologies.

title: Gold, Silver & Copper: tech and sustainability trends | EY - Canada
summary: Copper companies are addressing supply challenges by adopting digital innovations, AI, satellite technology, and advanced mineral processing like bioleaching to improve recovery rates. Recycling plays a critical role, with 32% of copper supply in 2023 coming from recycled sources, and companies increasingly partnering with cleantech firms to enhance sustainability and circular economy principles.

title: BHP's Copper Boom: Sustainable Mining to Meet Soaring Global Demand
summary: BHP reported record copper production with a 28% increase since FY22, driven by operational excellence and sustainable mining practices. The company is investing in renewable energy and recycling to support the energy transition, with key assets like Escondida achieving a 17-year production high while focusing on environmental stewardship.

title: 100% recycled copper contact wires - Rail EN
summary: The Dutch railway sector is implementing a world-first by replacing overhead contact wires with 100% recycled copper, reducing CO₂ emissions by 92% compared to mined copper. This initiative, involving La Farga and other partners, demonstrates significant environmental benefits including water and fossil fuel savings, while maintaining the same mechanical and electrical properties as traditional copper wires.

title: Nickel prices fell sharply on October 13 as Trump claimed to impose a 100% tariff on all Chinese goods
summary: On October 13, the price of SMM #1 refined nickel dropped by 1,400 yuan/mt to an average of 122,450 yuan/mt amid geopolitical tensions triggered by tariff announcements. This sharp decline reflects market sensitivity to trade policy developments.

title: On October 13, the SMM #1 refined nickel price was 121,000–123,900 yuan/mt, with an average price of 122,450 yuan/mt, down 1,400 yuan/mt from the previous day
summary: The refined nickel price on October 13 averaged 122,450 yuan/mt, marking a decrease of 1,400 yuan/mt from the previous trading day. This price movement aligns with broader market reactions to trade and economic factors.

title: Nickel price forecast | Is nickel a good investment for 2025?
summary: Nickel prices are forecasted to remain mostly bearish to neutral in 2025, with estimates around $15,400-$16,000 per tonne. Technical indicators suggest a weak trend with support and resistance levels identified near current prices, while market sentiment shows a strong tilt towards buyers.

title: Nickel Market Weakens on Oversupply and Soft Demand
summary: StoneX Senior Metals Analyst Natalie Scott-Gray explains that nickel prices have lost momentum in 2025 due to rising Indonesian production, record-high inventories, and weakening demand from the electric vehicle sector. The market is expected to experience surpluses for the fifth and sixth consecutive years, with traditional stainless-steel demand remaining crucial.

title: Fire at Indonesia Nickel Hub Raises Safety Concerns
summary: A fire occurred at Indonesia's largest nickel processing facility, the Morowali Industrial Park, causing minor injuries and affecting a scrubber tower under construction. While the incident had minimal immediate impact on production, it raises concerns about safety and potential regulatory impacts on Indonesia's nickel supply chain, which could influence global nickel markets.

title: Persistent Supply Disruptions Sustain Upward Pressure on LME Nickel Prices
summary: Ongoing supply disruptions in the nickel market continue to exert upward pressure on London Metal Exchange (LME) nickel prices. These disruptions contribute to market volatility and reflect tight supply conditions in the global nickel sector.

title: Nickel Breakout Looms as Indonesia Tightens Supply Ahead of 2026
summary: Nickel prices have been trading near the upper range for several months and may break out due to Indonesia tightening supply ahead of 2026. Ore prices have recently increased, and market participants are closely watching developments during key holiday periods in China that affect demand and supply dynamics.

title: Asian Battery Metals advances high-grade copper-nickel discovery in Mongolia
summary: Asian Battery Metals reported high-grade copper-nickel sulphide intercepts in Mongolia, with grades up to 6% copper and 3% nickel. The company is advancing exploration with promising metallurgy results and aims to establish a district-scale resource, positioning Mongolia as an emerging critical minerals hub near China.

title: Indonesia emerging as strategic hub in critical minerals supply chain
summary: Indonesia is increasingly recognized as a strategic hub in the global critical minerals supply chain, particularly for nickel. The country's role is expanding due to its large reserves and government policies supporting the sector, which impacts global nickel production capacity and supply security.

title: Sustainable Electrification Powered by Green Nickel
summary: Researchers at the Max Planck Institute for Sustainable Materials have developed a novel, carbon-free nickel extraction method using hydrogen plasma. This breakthrough enables the use of abundant low-grade nickel ores, which were previously underutilized due to high energy demands and complex chemistry, potentially reducing the carbon footprint of nickel production significantly.

title: Top 4 Nickel Companies Driving Electrification and Clean Energy in 2025
summary: Leading nickel producers like BHP are advancing sustainable nickel production with goals such as a 50% reduction in greenhouse gas emissions at Nickel West by 2030. BHP is investing heavily in expanding nickel capacity and modernizing operations, including partnerships with automakers like Tesla and Toyota to supply sustainable nickel for EV batteries.

title: Ardea Resources: Innovative sustainability initiatives defining KNP
summary: Ardea Resources integrates sustainability and ESG leadership into the Kalgoorlie Nickel Project through in-pit tailings disposal, on-site neutralization to reduce CO₂ emissions, and independent power generation using a sulphuric acid plant. The company is also exploring solar and renewable energy integration to further lower emissions and supports community development through education grants.

title: Genomines raises $45M to grow nickel from plants, not mines
summary: French start-up Genomines secured $45 million to scale its innovative phytoextraction technology, which uses plants to extract nickel from low-grade, non-arable land. This method offers faster deployment and lower operational costs compared to traditional mining, producing nickel concentrates with higher purity and significantly reducing environmental impact.

title: Greening nickel extraction requires institutional and financial support
summary: While promising low-carbon nickel extraction technologies exist, such as those reducing deforestation impacts, scaling these innovations requires overcoming institutional and financial barriers. Addressing these challenges is essential to reduce the overall carbon footprint of nickel mining and support sustainable industry growth.

title: Evolving nickel market trends, risks, outlook – key takeaways from Shirley Wang's speech at INSG meeting
summary: The global nickel market is shifting towards laterite nickel ore, with hydrometallurgical processing gaining prominence due to depletion of high-grade ores and environmental advantages. Indonesia's tight nickel ore policies continue to influence supply dynamics, while hydrometallurgy aligns with industry demands for low-cost, large-scale, and greener nickel production.

title: Nickel Institute seminar and cocktail reception - 2025
summary: The Nickel Institute hosted a seminar exploring how circularity, evolving recycling practices, and sustainability frameworks are reshaping the future of nickel. The event highlighted the industry's focus on sustainability and the role of nickel in supporting a low-carbon economy.

title: Sustainability of Nickel Mining in the Development of the Electric Vehicle Industry in ASEAN
summary: This research report examines the sustainability challenges and opportunities of nickel mining in ASEAN countries, emphasizing its critical role in supporting the electric vehicle industry's growth. It discusses environmental, social, and governance (ESG) factors influencing nickel mining practices in the region.

title: Cogne Acciai Speciali signs Memorandum of Understanding with CVA for photovoltaic plants in Sicily
summary: Cogne Acciai Speciali will benefit from enhanced energy performance and reduced environmental impact through the construction of four new photovoltaic plants in Sicily with a total capacity of over 20 MW. This agreement with CVA supports the company's decarbonisation goals and economic competitiveness as part of its 2026–2029 Strategic Plan.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Cogne Acciai Speciali finalizes acquisition of Mannesmann Stainless Tubes
summary: Cogne Acciai Speciali completed the €135 million acquisition of Mannesmann Stainless Tubes, expanding its footprint in the seamless tube and stainless steel nickel alloy pipes market. The acquisition integrates Mannesmann's production sites in Germany, France, Italy, and the US, enhancing Cogne's competitiveness in aerospace, automotive, and energy sectors.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Cogne Acciai Speciali launches green hydrogen pilot plant in Aosta
summary: Cogne Acciai Speciali has started operations at a green hydrogen pilot plant in Aosta, northern Italy, marking a significant step in sustainable steel production. This initiative aligns with the company's commitment to decarbonisation and innovation in specialty steel manufacturing.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Cogne Edelstahl GmbH advances sustainable production with hydrogen pilot project and ISO certification
summary: The German subsidiary of Cogne Acciai Speciali, Cogne Edelstahl GmbH, is implementing a hydrogen pilot project to reduce CO₂ emissions and has achieved ISO 9001 certification for its three German sites. The company also modernized its saw center in Stuhr to strengthen its market position with high-quality, sustainable stainless steel products.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Tenaris Acquires isOplus Oil and Gas Division in $10M Deal Expands Pipe Coating Business
summary: Tenaris acquired the oil and gas division of isOplus for $10 million, gaining ownership of pre-insulated pipeline systems for district heating and anti-corrosion coatings in Europe. The acquired business unit has been rebranded as Tenaris Coating Italy, enhancing Tenaris's offshore market offerings and enabling anti-corrosion coating application at its facilities in Italy and other countries.

title: Tenaris hosts panel on nuclear energy and Italy's boilermaking future
summary: Tenaris hosted a panel discussion in Italy focusing on the strategic role of nuclear energy in Europe's energy transition and Italy's boilermaking industry future. The event highlighted advances in nuclear technologies and Tenaris's recent accreditation to supply certified materials for nuclear facilities according to the ASME III standard, reflecting its commitment to quality and safety in the nuclear sector.

title: Tenaris in Italy achieves ASME certification for the supply of materials for the nuclear sector
summary: Tenaris's seamless steel pipe mill in Dalmine, Italy, obtained ASME III certification, qualifying it to supply certified materials for nuclear facilities. This accreditation supports Tenaris's participation in the low-carbon energy market by meeting stringent international standards essential for nuclear plant construction and maintenance.

title: Tenaris Completes $600M First Phase of $1.2B Buyback Program
summary: Tenaris completed the first $600 million tranche of its $1.2 billion share buyback program, repurchasing over 33 million shares representing 3.08% of its capital. The company plans to cancel these treasury shares to reduce share count and potentially increase earnings per share, reflecting a strong financial position.

title: Italian steel factory invests USD 14 mln in training center in Romania
summary: Italian steel manufacturer Tenaris invested USD 14 million in a training center for its 1,700 employees in Zalau, Romania. This investment aims to enhance workforce skills and support the company's operations in the region.

title: Prysmian wins 460 million euros power cable deal connecting Italy and Tunisia
summary: Prysmian has secured a contract worth around 460 million euros to build a submarine power cable connecting Italy and Tunisia under the Elmed Project. The cable will run from the Partanna substation in Sicily to the Mlaabi substation in Tunisia, supporting cleaner energy transition and energy security between Europe and Africa.

title: Prysmian Awarded The Italy-Tunisia Interconnection
summary: Prysmian was awarded the tender by Terna and STEG for the submarine power interconnection between Italy and Tunisia, part of the Elmed Project. The contract could reach 460 million euros and involves laying cables at depths up to 800 meters, enhancing energy security and supporting the shift to cleaner energy.

title: Italy awards Prysmian $539mn contract for Tunisia-Europe power cable
summary: Italian manufacturer Prysmian Group has been awarded a contract worth up to 460 million euros ($539 million) to build a submarine power cable linking Italy to Tunisia. This project is part of the Elmed initiative to create an energy bridge between Europe and Africa, enhancing energy security and integration.
